glsa.title: OpenTTD: Execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: Multiple buffer overflows in OpenTTD might allow for the execution of arbitrary code in the server.

background.p: OpenTTD is a clone of Transport Tycoon Deluxe.

description.p: Multiple buffer overflows have been reported in OpenTTD, when storing long for client names (CVE-2008-3547), in the TruncateString function in src/gfx.cpp (CVE-2008-3576) and in src/openttd.cpp when processing a large filename supplied to the "-g" parameter in the ttd_main function (CVE-2008-3577).

impact.p: An authenticated attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the OpenTTD server.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All OpenTTD users should upgrade to the latest version:
